sourcesContent:
import "./ahc.css" export default function Ahc16() { return (

How to stick with good habits everyday

  • Track them, best way is to use a habit tracker, DO NOT BREAK THE CHAIN
  • Recording your last action creates a trigger that can initiate your next one
  • The mere act of tracking a behaviour can spark the urge to change it
  • Most of us have a distorted view of our own behaviour, we think we act better than we do.
  • Measurement offers us blindness to our own behaviour and notice what’s really going on each day
  • When the evidence is right in front of you, you’re less likely to lie to yourself
  • The most effective form of motivation is progress, when we get a signal that we are moving forward, we become more motivated to continue down that path
  • Habit tracking provides you a visual proof of your hard work, how far you have come
  • Habit tracking can become its own form of reward
  • Habit tracking provides us visual proof that you are casting votes to the type of person you wish to become
  • The dark side of tracking a behaviour is we become driven by the number rather than the purpose behind it
  • We optimise what we measure, when we choose the wrong measurement we get the wrong behaviour
  • In a data driven world we overvalue numbers and undervalue anything ephemeral, soft and difficult to quantify
  • Just because you measure something doesn’t mean its the most important thing. And just because you can’t measure something doesn’t mean its not important
) }
